description: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin is recovering well after surgery for prostate cancer and subsequent complications that left him hospitalized for two weeks, doctors said, as the White House announced new delegation-of-authority policies for senior administration officials designed to avert similar crises in the future.
title: White House Sets New Absence Policy as Austin Is Set to Return

description: Presidential candidates are flocking to sun-drenched Florida this winter — and it’s not just for the warm weather.
title: Trump, Haley and Biden Head to Florida for 2024 Fundraisers

description: Australia’s Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has decided to take one of the biggest gambles of his political career.
title: Australia’s Prime Minister Goes All-In on Tax to Revive Political Fortunes

description: Venezuela’s top court closed the path for opposition leader Maria Corina Machado to run for president this year, raising questions about the future of a deal through which the US suspended sanctions on the country’s oil production in exchange for free and fair elections.
title: Venezuela Blocks Opposition Leader Machado’s Presidential Run

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: It’s Full Steam Ahead for Biden and Trump 2024 Campaigns

description: The US hopes a fresh hostage deal between Israel and Hamas will create the space for talks to achieve a more lasting regional peace agreement, a State Department official said Friday, offering a longer-term vision for the Biden administration as its negotiators criss-cross the region in search of a breakthrough.
title: US Aims to Use Israeli Hostage Deal to Open Wider Peace Talks

description: The fuel tanker operated on behalf of Trafigura Group that was struck by a missile as it transited the Red Sea was carrying Russian fuel, the trading giant said.
title: Oil Tanker Hit by Missile Was Carrying Russian Fuel, Trafigura Says

description: Top economic aides for President Joe Biden said he aims to preserve union jobs and domestic manufacturing in the US steel sector, a signal Nippon Steel Corp. may have to bolster its accommodation of organized labor to seal its takeover of United States Steel Corp.
title: Biden Aides Signal Importance of Union Jobs in Nippon Steel Review

description: Ontario, the most populous province in Canada and home to half the country’s foreign students, will require all colleges and universities to guarantee housing is available for incoming cohorts.
title: Ontario to Compel Colleges to Guarantee Foreign Student Housing

description: The White House said sexually-explicit AI-generated images of pop star Taylor Swift were concerning and that Congress should consider legislation to address fake, abusive images that are proliferating online.
title: White House Urges Action After ‘Alarming’ Taylor Swift Deepfakes

description: Yemen’s Houthi rebels said they attacked a British oil tanker in the Gulf of Aden with anti-ship missiles.
title: Houthis Say They Attacked Oil Tanker in Gulf of Aden

description: Charles Michel has dropped his plan to quit early as European Council president in order to run in this year’s European elections after a barrage of criticism.
title: EU Council President Michel Abandons Plan to Quit His Post Early

description: Venezuela arrested three aides to opposition candidate María Corina Machado as the government increases pressure on its critics ahead of presidential elections.
title: Venezuela Arrests Machado Allies as Tensions Flare Ahead of Vote

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz will travel to Washington in the first half of February for a meeting with US President Joe Biden, as the leaders look to rally support for additional assistance for Ukraine.
title: Germany’s Scholz to Visit Washington for Biden Meeting on Ukraine Aid

description: Donald Trump engaged in insurrection by inciting the Jan. 6 Capitol riot, a group of Colorado voters told the Supreme Court in a historic case that threatens the viability of his bid to reclaim the White House.
title: Trump Engaged in Insurrection, Voter Group Tells Supreme Court

description: The UK is pushing ahead with Brexit-related border checks next week, despite warnings from economists they will increase food price inflation.
title: UK Says Brexit Border Checks Will Begin Next Week as Planned

description: A merchant ship was on fire after being struck about 55 miles southeast of Aden, Yemen, maritime intelligence firm Ambrey Analytics said.
title: Merchant Ship Reportedly on Fire After Being Hit Near Yemen

description: Labour is slated to pledge close communication with business and backing for pro-growth City reforms as part of a fresh series of announcements next week.
title: Labour Party to Unveil Plans to Forge Deeper Ties With City of London

description: Canada is expected to resume exports of drone parts and other defense equipment to Turkey after the two countries reached an agreement on transparency around their usage, according to two Turkish officials who confirmed the deal on Friday.
title: Canada to Resume Drone Exports to Turkey After Defense Deal

description: Government ministers have agreed to meet with entrepreneurs and investors in an effort to allay a growing uproar over changes to the UK’s “angel investor” program.
title: UK Minister to Meet Angel Investors Amid Outcry Over Rule Change

description: The UK government has launched a new investigation into the takeover of the Telegraph Media Group backed by the United Arab Emirates, prolonging the uncertainty over the newspaper group’s future.
title: UK Starts New Probe Into Telegraph Buyout by UAE-Backed Redbird

description: French Prime Minister Gabriel Attal unveiled measures ranging from a refusal to sign a free trade treaty to lighter regulation on hedgerows as his government tried to defuse farmers’ fury over falling incomes and stringent European regulations.
title: France’s Attal Vows to Put Farmers First in Bid to End Protests

description: Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo said the US is considering new requirements for cloud providers to report any time a foreign user tries to develop models that power artificial intelligence.
title: Raimondo Floats Cloud Reporting Rules on Non-US AI Developers

description: President Vladimir Putin said the military plane that crashed in the Belgorod region on Wednesday was shot down by Ukrainian air defense, echoing earlier comments from Russian military officials.
title: Putin Says Russian Plane Was Downed by Ukraine’s Air Defense

description: House Speaker Mike Johnson said Friday a brewing Senate deal tying immigration to emergency aid for Ukraine would be impossible to pass in his Republican-controlled chamber.
title: Mike Johnson Calls Bipartisan Senate Border Plan ‘Dead On Arrival’

description: The White House expects consumer sentiment to continue improving and strong employment numbers to drive US economic growth, President Joe Biden’s top economic adviser said.
title: Brainard Says Jobs, Falling Inflation Paint Upbeat US Outlook

description: As Israel’s assault against Hamas in Gaza grinds on and the civilian death toll grows, there’s been growing international pressure on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to end the campaign. Netanyahu has rejected those calls, vowing to destroy the Palestinian militant group that killed hundreds of Israelis in an October raid. On Jan. 11, South Africa’s government called upon the International Court of Justice, the main judicial body of the United Nations, to rule Israel’s actions in Gaza to be ge
title: All About South Africa’s Genocide Case Against Israel

description: Climate activists declared victory after the Biden administration announced it was freezing new approvals to export liquefied natural gas, canceling a planned three-day sit-in at the US Energy Department.
title: Climate Activists Cancel Protests, Declare Victory After Biden’s LNG Freeze

description: The United Nations fired several staffers at its Palestinian refugee agency over Israeli allegations that they took part in the Oct. 7 attack by Hamas, news that prompted the US to suspend funding.
title: US Halts Funding for UN Agency Over Claims Staff Joined Oct. 7 Hamas Attacks

description: Just minutes after New York writer E. Jean Carroll’s lawyer started her closing arguments in a high-stakes defamation trial against Donald Trump, the former president abruptly got up and stalked out of the courtroom Friday.
title: Trump Storms Out of Carroll Defamation Trial, Angers Judge

description: Poland’s parliament will investigate the alleged use of Pegasus spyware by former ruling nationalists, opening a new front in a clash between the country’s main political factions.
title: Poland’s Tusk Sets Up Latest Standoff With Pegasus Spying Probe

description: The European Union is preparing to rule out a renewal of a key Ukraine gas pipeline deal with Russia when it expires at the end of the year, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Prepares to Rule Out Ukraine Gas Transit Deal With Russia

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: A Collection Of Rejection: A Difficult Week For Sunak

description: The Czech Republic took a step toward tightening gun controls a month after the worst mass shooting in the central European nation’s history triggered public pressure to overhaul laws regulating weapon ownership.
title: Czechs to Tighten Gun Control Rules After Worst Mass Shooting

description: Israel must immediately act to prevent the killing and harm to innocent Palestinians in Gaza, the United Nations’ top court ruled, stopping short of ordering a halt to its military operations there.
title: UN Court Rules Israel Must Prevent Killing, Harm of Palestinians

description: The German government urged Kosovo to delay plans to enforce the euro as its sole currency amid worries that the move could compound ethnic tensions by disrupting cash access to ethnic Serbs in the country’s north.
title: Germany Urges Kosovo to Postpone Currency Change in Serb Enclave

description: Moldovan authorities are cracking down on attempts to secure citizenship through fraud as the former Soviet republic seeks European Union accession and shifts away from Russian dominance.
title: Moldova Cracks Down on Citizenship Fraud as It Seeks to Join EU

description: Hundreds of thousands of public sector workers in Ireland are poised to receive a pay rise after months of talks between unions and the government ended with an agreement early Friday.
title: Irish Public Sector Workers Get Pay Rise After Months of Talks

description: Denmark’s government will use its law firm to go after companies owned by a reticent billionaire to pay for the cleanup of a landslide of contaminated soil that may trigger an environmental disaster.
title: Denmark Targets Media-Shy Billionaire to Pay for Toxic Landslide

description: Chile traders expect the central bank to deliver a jumbo interest rate cut of 100 basis points next week, speeding up the pace of monetary easing for the second time in a row as inflation slows toward target.
title: Chile Traders See Jumbo Interest Rate Cut of 100 Basis Points Coming Next Week

description: Javier Milei, Argentina's president, during a special address on day two of the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos, Switzerland, on Wednesday, Jan. 17, 2024. The annual Davos gathering of political leaders, top executives and celebrities runs from January 15 to 19.
title: Milei Fires Argentina Infrastructure Chief, Papers Report

description: Ethiopia’s deputy prime minister resigned as a vice president of the ruling Prosperity Party and will be replaced by the head of the nation’s intelligence agency, a government official said.
title: Ethiopian Deputy Prime Minister Leaves Top Ruling Party Post

description: El Al is stopping flights to Johannesburg at the end of March due to what it says is a collapse in passenger demand since South Africa charged Israel with genocide in its war against Hamas.
title: El Al Stops South Africa Route After ICJ Case Against Israel

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: South Africa Wins However Its Israel Case Ends

description: Zambian President Hakainde Hichilema said his country is a “guinea pig” for a Group of 20 plan to help poor countries restructure unaffordable debts and that failure to win relief would mean disaster for others needing help.
title: ‘Guinea Pig’ Zambia Warns of Disaster If Debt Relief Fails

description: Latvia has benefitted vastly from being part of Europe’s common currency, according to the central bank chief.
title: Euro Is Our Financial NATO, Latvian Central Bank Chief Says

description: Joe Biden and Donald Trump will face the greatest tests yet of their political strength starting this week in South Carolina, as the two men hurtle toward a general election rematch.
title: Trump and Biden Face Greatest Political Tests Yet in South Carolina

description: A Kenyan court halted a government plan to send police forces to rein in powerful gangs in Haiti, saying such a deployment would be unconstitutional.
title: Kenyan Court Blocks Deployment of Police to Fight Crime in Haiti

description: Piracy off Somalia’s coast has increased since maritime security was disrupted by Houthi militants’ attacks on ships in the Red Sea in response to the Israel-Hamas war.
title: After Red Sea Threats, Ships Now Face Rise in Somali Piracy

description: The top leadership of South Africa’s ruling party will consider whether it should part ways with its former leader Jacob Zuma at a three-day meeting that begins Friday, a move that will likely alienate part of its support base as it gears up to contest its toughest election yet.
title: South Africa’s Ruling Party Weighs Parting Ways With Zuma

description: China reiterated its call for Houthis militants to stop their attacks on Red Sea shipping, comments that come after Beijing reportedly asked Tehran to help rein in the rebel group.
title: China Calls for a Halt to Houthi Attacks on Red Sea Shipping

description: European Union leaders are moving toward an agreement next week to transfer some €50 billion ($54.1 billion) in aid to Ukraine, Latvia’s leader said.
title: EU Likely to Agree on Aid for Ukraine Next Week, Rinkevics Says

description: European Central Bank Governing Council member Fabio Panetta renewed pressure on the continent to jointly issue bonds — calling it a “critical” step for the common currency, despite political resistance.
title: ECB’s Panetta Sees Common Safe Asset as Crucial for Europe

description: A Kenyan court blocked the government from collecting a housing levy that President William Ruto wants to use to fund a low-cost housing program.
title: Kenyan Court Quashes State’s Appeal to Keep Collecting House Tax

description: China’s Ministry of Commerce declared 2024 the “year of promoting consumption” as it stressed the need to revitalize demand and attract more investment in the world’s second-largest economy.
title: China’s Commerce Ministry Vows to Boost Consumption, FDI in 2024

description: The disapproval rating for South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol hit its highest level in about nine months in a major poll amid escalating questions over whether the first lady inappropriately received a designer bag.
title: South Korea President Stumbles in Poll Over Dior Bag Uproar

description: Swiss voters are in favor of increasing pension payments while opposed to tying the retirement age to life expectancy, a poll seven weeks before a national vote showed.
title: Swiss Voters Favor Spending More on Pensions, Poll Shows

description: Emmanuel Macron’s government will try to defuse French farmers’ fury over falling incomes and stringent European regulations, in an attempt to stop demonstrations from escalating into a blockade of Paris.
title: Macron Makes Last-Ditch Bid to Stop Farmers Blockading Paris

description: Berjaya Land Bhd., which has links to the family of Malaysia’s incoming king, jumped following a report that its unit is leading a consortium that’s bidding for the high-speed rail project between Kuala Lumpur and Singapore.
title: Malaysia Royalty-Linked Stock Jumps on Singapore Rail Bid Report

description: China’s central bank unveiled broad plans to guide money into sectors of national importance to boost the faltering economy this year, after making an unusual reserve requirement ratio announcement.
title: China Signals More Targeted Stimulus to Come

description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — North Korea said Friday it was hosting a visit by a Chinese government delegation led by Vice Foreign Minister Sun Weidong, as it continues its efforts to strengthen ties with Beijing and Moscow in the face of deepening confrontations with Washington.
title: Chinese Foreign Minister Visits North Korea in Latest Diplomacy Act

description: Japan’s Tokyo Electric Power Co. will conduct seven rounds of treated water discharge from the wrecked Fukushima nuclear disaster site during the fiscal year starting April, according to the plan announced by the firm on Thursday.
title: Tepco Plans Seven Rounds of Fukushima Water Discharge in FY2024

description: The runup to Pakistan’s Feb. 8 elections may be a good time to bet on a continued move higher in the country’s stocks, history shows.
title: World-Beating Pakistani Stock Rally May Get Boost From Elections

description: A South Korean ruling party lawmaker was in stable condition after being struck repeatedly in the head by a rock-wielding assailant in the second attack this month on a prominent politician, which has stoked safety concerns.
title: South Korean Lawmaker Treated for Head Cuts After Being Attacked with Rock
